snippet: Christine C. Quinn, speaker of the City Council and a candidate for mayor, is often questioned about her disposition and tendency to raise her voice.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column contends City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn has faced criticism in her run for New York City mayor about her disposition and short temper; holds that many New Yorkers, as well as their past mayors, have similar dispositions, and wonders if criticism is based on Quinn's gender.
lead_paragraph: Christine C. Quinn, speaker of the City Council and a candidate for mayor, is often questioned about her disposition and tendency to raise her voice.

headline.main: Wondering What’s So Novel About a New York Politician With a Temper
headline.print_headline: Wondering What’s So Novel About a New York Politician With a Temper
